CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , an order for payment , if issued on the basis of a bill of exchange , is enforceable notwithstanding that a defendant has appealed against it , and that proceedings relating to the final determination of the claim arising from the endorsement of the bill are still pending .

A district court is competent to issue an order for payment ; however , on an appeal by a defendant , the case may subsequently be referred to a regional court if , in view of the value of the claim , that court is competent to deal with the case in ordinary civil proceedings .

CARDINAL . Under LAW seq . of LAW a debtor may lodge a complaint against any action taken by a bailiff in enforcement proceedings . He may , in particular , seek a ruling as to whether the bailiff ’s actions were correct , i.e. taken in accordance with a writ of execution , and lawful , i.e. whether the means of enforcement applied in a given case were provided by law . Such a complaint is examined by a district court under the provisions of Volume II of LAW relating to enforcement proceedings .
